lines.text:
[the stolen gold is delayed and Fabrizi has to shoot some of his 'neo-realist' film]
We are ready for the next shot, only in this scene instead of doing *nothing*, we do *something*.

[exasperated]
What?
Running, running.
What are we running from?
From yourselves. Uh, you get the symbolic meaning?
[Tony shakes his head 'no']
Aah! No matter how fast you run, you can never run away from yourselves!
Aahh! Beautiful!
Aagghh! If only I could steal enough to become an honest man!

[as Fabrizi, explaining the concept of his movie]
Tony plays 'The Fox'...

[interrupting]
An animal picture!
No, "The Fox", a master criminal with an ingenious plan to smuggle gold into Italy, and - a surprise ending!
What's the ingenious plan?
THAT is the surprise ending.
I love it! When do we start shooting?
I want more sand in the desert!

[to the police chief]
In films either you have got a face or you don't got a face. You have got a face.
Because I am a small crook, I go to prison. It's only the big crooks that go free. Is that justice?
I'll get you a new stove, with push buttons!
I don't want buttons! I want GRANDCHILDREN!
[Breaks down in tears]
You hear that Gina, your Mama wants Grandchildren!
You're a crook. Steal her some!
Mama, look the other way. I'm going to kill Gina.
Good morning!
Ooh! A good, strong "Good Morning"! OOOH!
[Passionately throws papers in the air]
OOOH! Sorry, we Artists must give vent to our emotions. And I have just vented... Good morning.
[Leaves]

[to mirror, trying it on]
Good morning!
